creator: samve
title: How to digitize a sketch using inkscape
description: This project explains how to digitize a hand-drawn sketch into a vector image using Inkscape. This allows you to use the sketch for logos, stencils, and other digital applications.
steps: Scan your sketch, ensuring the lines are as dark as possible. You may edit the scan to increase contrast and brightness.
Open the scanned file in Inkscape.

Go to Path -> Trace Bitmap. If the sketch is black and white, select 'two colors', 'remove background' and set to grays. If it contains more colors, select the desired number of colors and choose 'colors' instead of 'grays'. Press OK to confirm.
Smooth out edges if necessary by going to Path -> Simplify.
Remove any unwanted spots or artifacts from the scan by selecting and deleting them.
Shape the edges by double-clicking lines/shapes to reveal nodes and adjusting them as needed.
If the sketch wasn't already colored, use the bucket tool to fill in the blank spaces with the desired colors.
The sketch is now digitized. Save it as a vector image, another image format, or export it as a PNG.
